intro: Commersonia fraseri var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved Commersonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to southern Australia, where it typically grows in heathland and dry forest environments. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or cream, arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils and can tolerate drought conditions.
